intro: Homotropium erythrorhizum var. latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf redroot, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant has a creeping habit with stolons that root at the nodes, forming dense mats. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its root system is notable for its reddish coloration, which is a distinguishing feature of the species.
